page.title: 12TREMORE SCHOOL (PRIVATE)
page.content: 1Tremore School is a private school - that is, it is not owned by the Authority and the parents pay Â£8 a week per child. The teachers are not trained like our teachers and neither do they have classes like ours. The children sit in one big room, always working from set books. They have desks with wooden cubicles around them.They have to wave a union jack if they want the teacher's attention.They are not allowed to talk unless the teacher wants them to.They are given a de-merit mark if they stand up.There are no school dinners so the children bring packed lunches.They do not have a television, a video or musical instruments.All their books are sent from a Christian centre in America. There is a test in every book. If the results are not good enough the child has to do all the book again.
